content:
Diagnosis:		Inflammatory breast cancer, right breast

Stage:		T4dN1M0 (Stage IIIB)

Biomarkers:	Triple negative breast cancer (ER/PR/HER2 negative)
		BRCA1 pathogenic variant detected

Management:	Commenced neoadjuvant chemotherapy

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 2 dose-dense AC

[redacted name] was reviewed today prior to cycle 2 chemotherapy. She has completed her first cycle of dose-dense doxorubicin/cyclophosphamide on 15/3/24. The inflammatory changes in her right breast have shown early improvement with reduced erythema and induration. The initial presenting symptoms of breast warmth and heaviness have significantly improved. Performance status remains 1.

On examination, there is reduced erythema of the right breast compared to initial presentation. The skin thickening and peau d'orange appearance persist but are improved. The 4cm palpable mass at 2 o'clock position remains unchanged. No suspicious axillary lymphadenopathy.

Blood results are satisfactory for proceeding with cycle 2. She has experienced grade 1 nausea and fatigue but otherwise tolerated treatment well. Plan to continue with cycle 2 today as scheduled. Will review again in 2 weeks prior to cycle 3.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: Triple negative (ER/PR/HER2 negative), BRCA1 pathogenic variant positive

cancer_timeline.value: Early improvement in inflammatory changes with reduced erythema and induration after first cycle

patient_facts.value: 4cm palpable mass at 2 o'clock position in right breast
Reduced erythema with persistent skin thickening and peau d'orange

status_updates.value: Inflammatory breast cancer showing early response to first cycle of neoadjuvant chemotherapy with improving inflammatory changes
Grade 1 nausea and fatigue from first cycle of AC chemotherapy
Proceeding with cycle 2 dose-dense AC chemotherapy as planned
Review in 2 weeks prior to cycle 3
